content.text: Learn how to create tab headers with CSS and JavaScript.
content.html: Learn how to create tab headers with CSS and JavaScript.

content.text: Click on the "city" buttons to display the appropriate header:
content.html: Click on the "city" buttons to display the appropriate header:

content.text: London is the capital city of England.
content.html: London is the capital city of England.

content.text: Paris is the capital of France.
Tokyo is the capital of Japan.
Oslo is the capital of Norway.

content.code:
London

 

London is the capital city of England.

Paris

 

Paris is the capital of France.

 

Tokyo

 

Tokyo is the capital of Japan.

Oslo

 

Oslo is the capital of Norway.
content.code_html:
<div id="London" class="tabcontent">
  <h1>London</h1>
  <p>London is the capital city of England.</p>
</div>

<div id="Paris" class="tabcontent">
  <h1>Paris</h1>
  <p>Paris is the capital of France.</p>
</div>

<div id="Tokyo" class="tabcontent">
  <h1>Tokyo</h1>
  <p>Tokyo is the capital of Japan.</p>
</div>

<div id="Oslo" class="tabcontent">
  <h1>Oslo</h1>
  <p>Oslo is the capital of Norway.</p>
</div>

<button class="tablink" onclick="openCity('London', this, 'red')" id="defaultOpen">London</button>
<button class="tablink" onclick="openCity('Paris', this, 'green')">Paris</button>
<button class="tablink" onclick="openCity('Tokyo', this, 'blue')">Tokyo</button>
<button class="tablink" onclick="openCity('Oslo', this, 'orange')">Oslo</button>

content.text: Create buttons to open specific tab content. All <div> elements with class="tabcontent" are hidden by default (with CSS & JS). When the user clicks on a button - it will open the tab content that "matches" this button.
content.html: Create buttons to open specific tab content. All <div> elements with class="tabcontent" are hidden by default (with CSS & JS). When the user clicks on a button - it will open the tab content that "matches" this button.

content.text: Style the buttons and the tab content:
content.html: Style the buttons and the tab content:

syntaxHighlighting.text: /* Change background color of buttons on hover */
/* Set default styles for tab content */

color: white;  display: none;  
  padding: 50px;  text-align: center;

syntax_highlighting.text: /* Change background color of buttons on hover */
/* Set default styles for tab content */

color: white;  display: none;  
  padding: 50px;  text-align: center;

content.code_html:
/* Style the tab buttons */
.tablink {
  background-color: #555;
  color: white;
  float: left;
  border: none;
  outline: none;
  cursor: pointer;
  padding: 14px 16px;
  font-size: 17px;
  width: 25%;
}

/* Change background color of buttons on hover */
.tablink:hover {
  background-color: #777;
}

/* Set default styles for tab content */
.tabcontent {
  color: white;
  display: none;
  padding: 50px;
  text-align: center;
}

/* Style each tab content individually */
#London {background-color:red;}
#Paris {background-color:green;}
#Tokyo {background-color:blue;}
#Oslo {background-color:orange;}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: /* Change background color of buttons on hover */
/* Set default styles for tab content */

color: white;  display: none;  
  padding: 50px;  text-align: center;

syntaxHighlighting.text:
// Hide all 
  elements with class="tabcontent" by default */
// Remove the background color of all tablinks/buttons
// Add the specific color to the button used to open the tab content

// Get the element with id="defaultOpen" 
  and click on it

syntax_highlighting.text:
// Hide all 
  elements with class="tabcontent" by default */
// Remove the background color of all tablinks/buttons
// Add the specific color to the button used to open the tab content

// Get the element with id="defaultOpen" 
  and click on it

content.code_html:
function openCity(cityName, elmnt, color) {
  // Hide all elements with class="tabcontent" by default */
  var i, tabcontent, tablinks;
  tabcontent = document.getElementsByClassName("tabcontent");
  for (i = 0; i < tabcontent.length; i++) {
    tabcontent[i].style.display = "none";
  }

  // Remove the background color of all tablinks/buttons
  tablinks = document.getElementsByClassName("tablink");
  for (i = 0; i < tablinks.length; i++) {
    tablinks[i].style.backgroundColor = "";
  }

  // Show the specific tab content
  document.getElementById(cityName).style.display = "block";

  // Add the specific color to the button used to open the tab content
  elmnt.style.backgroundColor = color;
}

// Get the element with id="defaultOpen" and click on it
document.getElementById("defaultOpen").click();
